page.title: 15INDUSTRY_ST.MARTINS AREA
page.content: In{Dudleston}there is an{old school which is now a{carpet warehouse.}It used to be just two big rooms with a fireplace in each.It was built in 1852 and stopped being a{school}in 1962.The roof was made of wood and there was a bike shed arond the back.The teacher lived in the{school,}but Mr.Roberts lives there now.There was an extension built in 1972.Now one big room is used for{storing carpets}and the other room has a snooker table in. From St.Martins travel west along the Ellesmere road to{New Hall. New Hall {Timber}is a{timber dryers.}They mostly dry{oak}but also{ash,elm,yew,beech, {maple,sycamore}and{chestnut.}The wood is then sent away to make doors,window frames,tables and staircases.The firm is owned by Mr.Evans who employs two other men.It is open five days a week from 8.00.a.m. to 5.00.p.m.
